content: this legal text summarizes the progress of a family court case in henegouwen which has been ongoing for 5 years and 26 days it involves a divorce between two parties mr ac and mrs vh both parties have raised objections and the document instructs a notary to adjust a liquidation statement accordingly as part of the divorce settlement mr ac is required to pay half of the net value of an insurance contract to mrs vh while she is liable to pay him for the costs of the divorce proceedings the court allows the judgment to be enforced provisionally even if there is an appeal the text provides background information on the marriage separation and the appointment of a notary for asset liquidation it also discusses disputes over the allocation of property and concludes by addressing legal arguments regarding repossession and preferential allocation another legal text discusses a case involving mr c and ms h without providing specific details it mentions their contributions to a family home and disputes over bank withdrawals and a rental guarantee the text concludes that ms hs objections are unfounded based on legal provisions and court judgments in another case ms h criticizes the valuation of a group insurance policy and requests a delay until mr c reaches retirement age the text presents arguments and court decisions on the matter and determines that mr c should pay ms h half of the net contractual value of the policy on the date of their divorce the text also addresses the division of costs related to the divorce decree and authorizes provisional execution of the judgment
